intro: Hieracium archaeum, commonly known as the ancient dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers develop into a crown of white bracts. Hieracium archaeum is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
